jparsec.math

Class Polynomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.Polynomial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Polynomial
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

    Represents a polynomial equation of the form p(x) = A + B*x + C*x^2 + D*x^3 + ... where A, B, C, etc are either real or complex coefficients.

    Includes a method for finding the zeros of a complex polynomial by the three stage complex algorithm of Jenkins and Traub. The method finds the zeros one at a time in roughly increasing order of modulus and deflates the polynomial to one of lower degree. This method is extremely fast and timing is quite insenstive to distribution of zeros.

    Zero finder ported from FORTRAN version of algorithm 419 courtesy Netlib Repository.

    This class is not thread-safe.

    Version:
    December 4, 2004
    Author:
    Joseph A. Huwaldt Date: July 15, 2000
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Polynomial

        public Polynomial()
        Default constructor that creates the polynomial p(x) = 0.

      • Polynomial

        public Polynomial(Complex[] coefficients)
        Constructor that takes an array of complex coefficients. Coefficients are supplied in order of increasing power. Example: p(x) = A + B*x + C*x^2 + D*x^3 + E*x^4 gives coefficients[] = {A, B, C, D, E}.
        Parameters:
        coefficients - An array of complex coefficients in order of increasing power.

      • Polynomial

        Parameters:
        coefficients - An array of real coefficients in order of increasing power.

      • evaluate

        public Complex evaluate(double xr,
               double xi)
        Evaluate this polynomial at a complex x and returns the generally complex result. Uses the method of Horner Recurrence.
        Parameters:
        xr - The real component of the point at which to evaluate this polynomial.
        xi - The imaginary component of the point at which to evaluate this polynomial.
        Returns:
        The evaluation of this polynomial at the complex x.

      • slope

        public Complex slope(double xr,
            double xi)
        Evaluate the slope "dP(x)/dx" of this polynomial at a complex x and return the generally complex result. Uses the method of Horner Recurrence with added slope calculation.
        Parameters:
        xr - The real component of the point at which to evaluate this polynomial.
        xi - The imaginary component of the point at which to evaluate this polynomial.
        Returns:
        The slope "dP(x)/dx" of this polynomial at the complex x.

      • zeros

        public Complex[] zeros()
                throws JPARSECException
        Finds all the roots or zeros of this polynomial. Zeros may be real or complex. Uses the standard black-box method of Jenkins & Traub. This method finds the polynomial zeros one at a time in roughly increasing order of modulus. The algorithm is extremely fast and is relatively insensitive to the distribution of zeros. The algorithm is also known from historical applications to be very reliable.
        Returns:
        An array of all the generally complex zeros or roots of this polynomial.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - if there is a problem finding the zeros of the polynomial.
